edu.ncsu.csc216.train_travel.transportation

Class Train

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.train_travel.transportation.Train

  • public class Train
extends java.lang.Object
    A concrete class made up of FirstClassCars, SecondClassCars and BicycleTransportCars. Also keeps track of the total number of ComfortClass, EconomyClass and BicycleClass passengers.
    Author:
    Noah Benveniste

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Train(int numberOfCars)
      Constructs a Train object of a specified length with no passengers

        public Train(int numberOfCars)
        Constructs a Train object of a specified length with no passengers
        Parameters:
        numberOfCars - the length of the Train in number of cars
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length specified is not between 4 and 12

      • getSeatFor

        public Seat getSeatFor(int carNum,
                       int row,
                       int col)
        Gets the seat at the specified zero-based row,column index in the specified car
        Parameters:
        carNum - the index of the car to get the seat from
        row - the zero-based row index of the seat
        col - the zero-based column index of the seat
        Returns:
        the seat located at row,col in the specified car
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if row,col is out of bounds or carNum is out of bounds

      • getSeatFor

        public Seat getSeatFor(int carNum,
                       java.lang.String label)
        Gets the seat specified by a label in the specified car
        Parameters:
        carNum - the index of the car to get the seat from
        label - the seat's label in the form
        Returns:
        the seat specified by the label in the specified car
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the seat label is invalid for the specified car or if carNum is out of bounds
